label: Web Services Bug Reports
description:
Random: AWS.NotAuthorized Errors We have been using the Alexa web information service since 2004 and have successfully migrated our software from Alexa's old XML feed through the AWS beta and now to the AWS 1.0 Service successfully. However, since we migrated to the AWS 1.0 product we have begun to see random AWS.NotAuthorized errors with our queries. They appear to be totally random as we can execute the same software on the same computer repeatedly (within seconds) and receive different results from the AWS servers.
 
After lots of testing we have been able to determine a pattern to the problem: it appears when the base-64 encoded signature in the request contains a "+" symbol in the base64 encoded string we always receive an AWS.NotAuthorized error.
 
We have checked many other aspects of our software: our servers are all time-synched; we are running Java 1.5_04, which has RFC compliant HMAC_SHA1 hashing; And our base64 library has been tested to be RFC 3548 compliant.
 
We have changed our software so that when a signature containing a "+" is encountered we sleep and then re-generate a new signature until we have one without a "+". This has fixed our problem but I am curious of other people are seeing the same issue or have any other thoughts.
 
We have attached a segment of our log for more information.
